subject: Negotiation
title: Individualism vs. Collectivism in Deals
description: A short lesson to help you apply Individualism vs. Collectivism in Deals.

hook.text: In the US, one person can close a deal. In China, the whole team needs to agree first.

buildup.text: Individualist cultures value personal authority and fast decisions. Collectivist cultures seek group consensus.

discovery.text: Pushing a collectivist negotiator for a solo decision insults their process and usually backfires.

twist.text: Collectivist decisions take longer but are more stable â€” the whole group is already committed.

climax.text: Adjust your timeline: individualist deals close fast; collectivist deals take time but stick.

punchline.text: Fast decisions or lasting ones? Culture decides which you'll get.

quiz.question: Why do collectivist culture negotiations take longer?
options: The whole group needs to reach consensus
They don't trust the other side
